summary: This is an email exchange between attorney Jay Lefkowitz and U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta regarding the Epstein case. Lefkowitz requests that Acosta not send a letter to Judge Davis before they speak, indicating coordination on legal strategy. The email includes a confidentiality notice from Kirkland & Ellis LLP.

keyFacts: Attorney Jay Lefkowitz was in direct communication with U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta about the Epstein case in October 2007.
The communication shows coordination between Epstein's defense team (via Lefkowitz) and the prosecution (Acosta) regarding a letter to Judge Davis.
The email indicates there were 'a few limited areas of disagreement' with Acosta's proposed letter to the judge.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and attorney-client privileged, coming from Kirkland & Ellis LLP.
The timing (2007) corresponds with the period when Epstein's controversial non-prosecution agreement was being negotiated.
